column2: (to Monica) Hey, how much will you give me to eat this whole jar of\nolives?'
I won\xc2\x92t give you anything, but you\xc2\x92ll owe me 2.95.'
Done.'
(entering) Hey. I need an atlas! I need an atlas!'
Why? (in a motherlike tone) Do you have a report due?'
I have a date with this diplomat I met while I was giving free massages\noutside the UN and, I don\xc2\x92t know where his country is.'
Okay, let\xc2\x92s start with the free messages outside the UN.'
Oh!! That\xc2\x92s my new thing. I figure bodies at peace, make peace.'
Wow! You might just get the first Nobel prize in rubbing. So what\ncountry is this guy from?'
Ick-neck-tree-anis..... There\xc2\x92s a \xc2\x91g\xc2\x92 in there.'
Where\xc2\x92s that?'
In your atlas!'
I don\xc2\x92t have an atlas.'
Oh.'
Oh, but wait I do have a globe.'
Oh.'
Hold on.'
So Pheebs what\xc2\x92s this guy like?'
Umm, well he\xc2\x92s very dashing, y'know, and umm, very, very\nsophisticated, and he doesn\xc2\x92t speak any English, but according to his translator, he\ntotally gets me."
\xc2\x91Kay, here you go. (Hands her this tiny little globe.)'
What is this?'
It\xc2\x92s a globe and, a pencil sharpener.'
(entering) Hey, does anybody need anything copied? I\xc2\x92m going down\nto the Xerox place.'
Oh, no thanks.'
Okay listen, just give me anything I can make two of.'
Well, if you don\xc2\x92t have anything to copy, why are you going down\nthere?'
Yeah, are you just going down there to gawk at that hot girl with the\nbelly button ring again?'
Yeah! You wanna come?'
Yeah!'
Come on Chloe! Finish up with your customer first. Come on Chloe! Come\non Chloe!!'
(to Chandler and Joey) Can I help you?'
Uh-oh.'
Uh, y'know what, we\xc2\x92re having second thoughts about our copying\nneeds. And we\xc2\x92ll need a little more time to think about it."
Chloe, switch with me, there\xc2\x92s some guys here that got a crush on\nyou.'
(to Joey) Okay, that hurt us.'
Hi guys. I haven\xc2\x92t seen you since this morning.'
Well ah, ........y'know."
Hey, what are you guys doing tomorrow night?'
Both of us? (points to Chandler and himself)'
Maybe. Does that scare ya?'
Relax. It\xc2\x92s just Issac\xc2\x92s D.J.-ing at the Philly. You should\ncome.'
We\xc2\x92ll be there.'
Great. I\xc2\x92ll ah, see ya then.'
All right, rock on. (Does the \xc2\x91Hang 10\xc2\x92 sign, then hides his\nface in shame.)'
(something in Russian or Polish)'
He\xc2\x92s says, \xc2\x91Walking with you makes this strange city, feel\nlike home.\xc2\x92'

Me too. Although this city is my home, so. So that\xc2\x92s dumb what I\nsaid, don\xc2\x92t tell him I said that. Umm, you make something up. (Mischa does so and\nSergei kisses her hand.) Nice, (to Mischa) thank you. This is me. Here.'
(leaning in) Your eyes are very pretty.'
(to Mischa) Thank you, very much! Oh! (to Sergei) Thank you!'
(leaning in) He would like to kiss you.'

(to Mischa) Okay, y'know what, you don\xc2\x92t have to do that now.\n(Mischa translates that to Sergei) No-no-no-no!! Not him, you don\xc2\x92t! (Mischa tells\nSergei he can proceed and steps away) Well the moment\xc2\x92s over."
Oh.'
Oy!'
(pointing to the globe) See there it is right there.'
Wow! It\xc2\x92s small.'
Yeah. But Sergei said it took the Germans six weeks to get all the way\nacross it.'
So you had fun, huh?'
Yeah. Except for, y'know when you\xc2\x92re on a date and you\xc2\x92re\ngetting along really great but the guy\xc2\x92s translator keeps getting in the way."
No.'
(entering) Hey.'
Hey.'
What is ah, Rach in her room?'
Oh no, she\xc2\x92s still at work, but she told me to tell you to call\nher.'
Oh what?! Is she gonna cancel on me again?! How can she do this?\nDoesn\xc2\x92t she know it\xc2\x92s our anniversary?'
All right ah, Ross, this is the extent of my knowledge on the subject.\n(holds up a notepad) Call Rachel.'
What\xc2\x92s that on the bottom?'
Oh that\xc2\x92s my doodle of a ladybug, with a top hat. (to Phoebe)\nShe\xc2\x92s fancy.'
(answering her phone at work) Hello.'
Hey, honey.'
Oh, hi.'
Hey, what\xc2\x92s going on?'
Well, there was a disaster in shipping and I\xc2\x92ve got to get this\norder in. Honey, I\xc2\x92m so sorry, but it looks like I\xc2\x92m gonna be here all night.'
What, do you, well umm, oh how about I come up there?'
No-no-no, no, honey please, I\xc2\x92ve got, I\xc2\x92ve just have so much\nto deal with.'

(to Monica) Anyway, I\xc2\x92m going out with Sergei again tonight, and\num, could you come and be the translator\xc2\x92s date? So that when we, it\xc2\x92s time for\nour alone time, you two could split off. Y'know, he\xc2\x92s really, he\xc2\x92s kinda cute."
Yeah, well kinda cute, like really kinda cute, or kinda cute like your\nfriend Spackel Back Larry?'
Hey, don\xc2\x92t call him that! His name is Spackel Back Harry!'
Hey, y'know what, maybe we should get going. I mean what time did\nChloe say we should be there?"
Uh, 10
What time is it now?'
Yeah all right, so we\xc2\x92ll hang out.'
Yeah. Hey, remember when she brought up that thing about the three of us?'
Yes. Vividly.'
She was kidding about that right?'
Yeah, I-I-I think so. (Pauses and thinks about it for a second) Yeah,\nI-I think so...'
God, that would be weird it that situation presented itself tonight, huh?'
Yeah. Yeah, I mean what, what would we do?'
Dude, I don\xc2\x92t know.'
She was kidding.'
Yeah.'
She was.... But y'know what, just in case, maybe we should come up\nwith a set of ground rules."

Yeah, for sure. Okay. Probably want the first thing to be, never open your\neyes. Y'know, because you don\xc2\x92t want to be doing something and then look up and see\nsomething you don\xc2\x92t want to be seeing."
Yeah. Good call, nice one. Hold it!! Hold it! What if me eyes are\nclosed, and, and my hand is out there.... (holds his arm out and pretends to grab\nsomething with his hand.)'
Ah!! Okay! Eyes open at all times! Oh, hey, how do we decide where we...\n(clears throat) y'know each would, (clears throat again) y'know (pause) be?"
Right. Right. Well ah, y'know we could flip for it."
Yeah, I guess, but what\xc2\x92s like heads and what\xc2\x92s tails?'
Well it you don\xc2\x92t know that, then I don\xc2\x92t want to do this\nwith you.'

(on the phone) No, no, no, I\xc2\x92m looking at a purchase order right
here and it clearly states that we ordered the Rivera bikini in a variety of sizes and
colours. And.... (listens) What does it matter, what I\xc2\x92m wearing?! Can I please speak
to your supervisor? (listens) Thank you. (to Sophie) We\xc2\x92re holding.'
(entering, carrying a basket) Hi!'
(startled) Oh!! My God, what are you doing here?'
Well you said you couldn\xc2\x92t go out so.... (pulls the cover off of the\nbasket)'
You brought a picnic, oh, what a boyfriend. That\xc2\x92s it, on Monday I\nstart wearing make-up.'
Ross honey, this is very nice, but, but I-I got a crisis.'
Yeah, but I got cous-cous!'
Honey, honey, I\xc2\x92m sorry, I know it\xc2\x92s our anniversary but I\ntold you on the phone I don\xc2\x92t have time to stop.'
Okay, you don\xc2\x92t have to stop, I\xc2\x92m invisible, I\xc2\x92m not here.\n(lights a candle)'
But I don\xc2\x92t, hmm... (on phone) Oh, who approved that order?!\n(listens) Well there is no Mark Robbinson in this office. (to Sophie) Get me Mark on the\nphone!'
I love Mark. (to Ross) Do you know Mark?'
Yeah!!'

Well, let me just check that with what I got here, all right see 038 is\nnot the number for (Ross starts making a lot of noise with a handheld pepper grinder) this\nstore, 038 is Atlanta. And I...(stops and looks at Ross)'
(stopping grinding) Pepper?'
(angrily) None for me.'
Okay sorry, whew.'
I\xc2\x92m sorry, as I was saying the store number is wrong, and I\xc2\x92m\nsorry but that\xc2\x92s... (notices a fire that Ross\xc2\x92s candle has started) Oh my God!! '
(putting out the fire with a squeeze bottle of water) Okay, that\xc2\x92s a\nfire. Oh yeah. Oh yeah.'
(on phone) Excuse me, I\xc2\x92m sorry, I\xc2\x92m gonna have to call you\nback, I\xc2\x92ve got a Schemp in my office. (hangs up) (to Ross) What are you doing?'
I\xc2\x92m sorry. But ah, hey, oh, somebody\xc2\x92s off the phone, how\n\xc2\x91bout a glass of wine by the fire, I could get it going again.'
Ross you\xc2\x92re not listening to me, I don\xc2\x92t have time to stop.'
Come on Rach, you don\xc2\x92t have what, ten minutes?'
I don\xc2\x92t have ten minutes!!'
What? (to Sophie) Sophie, does she have ten minutes?'
Hey, Ross!!! I told you I don\xc2\x92t!'
Don\xc2\x92t yell at me okay, this is the most I\xc2\x92ve seen you all week.'
Look, I cannot do this right now, okay, I\xc2\x92ve got a deadline, would\nyou just go home, I\xc2\x92ll talk to you later. (storms out) '
Yeah, but wait...'
Good bye!'
Actually, that\xc2\x92s our three hole punch.'
Hey.'
Hi. Look um, about what happened earlier...'
No, hey, well, I-I completely understand. You were, you were stressed.'
(throws her stuff down) I was gonna give you a chance to apologise to\nme.'
For what? For letting you throw me out of your office?'
You had no right coming down to my office Ross. You do not bring\na picnic basket to somebody\xc2\x92s work! Unless maybe they were a park ranger!'
Yeah, well excuse me for wanting to be with my girlfriend on our\nanniversary, boy what an ass am I. '
But I told you, I didn\xc2\x92t have the time!'
Yeah, well you never have the time. I mean, I don\xc2\x92t feel like I even\nhave a girlfriend anymore, Rachel.'
Wh, Ross what do you want from me? You want me, you want me to quit my\njob so you can feel like you have a girlfriend?'
No, but it\xc2\x92d be nice if you realised, it\xc2\x92s just a job!'
Just a job!'
Yes.'

Ross do you realise this is the first time in my life I\xc2\x92m doing\nsomething I actually care about. This is the first time in my life I\xc2\x92m doing\nsomething that I\xc2\x92m actually good at. I mean. if you don\xc2\x92t get that...'

No, hey, I get that, okay, I get that big time. And I\xc2\x92m happy for ya,\nbut I\xc2\x92m tired of having a relationship with your answering machine! Okay, I\ndon\xc2\x92t know what to do anymore.'
Well neither do I!'
Is this about Mark?'
(shocked) Oh my God.'
Okay, it\xc2\x92s not, it\xc2\x92s not.'
Oh my God. I cannot keep having this same fight over and over again,\nRoss, no, you\xc2\x92re, you\xc2\x92re, you\xc2\x92re making this too hard.'
Oh I\xc2\x92m, I\xc2\x92m making this too hard. Okay, what do you want me to\ndo.'
I don\xc2\x92t know, I don\xc2\x92t know. Urrrgh! Look, maybe we should take\na break.'

Okay, okay, fine, you\xc2\x92re right. Let\xc2\x92s ah, let\xc2\x92s take a\nbreak, (goes to the door) let\xc2\x92s cool off, okay, let\xc2\x92s get some frozen yogart, or\nsomething.. (opens the door)'
No. (Ross is standing in the doorway.) A break from us.'
And the advances in collating in the past five years, I mean we just got\nin an X-5000, y'know. The X-5000 makes the X-50 look like a T-71. "
(seeing Ross enter) Hey, it\xc2\x92s the dinosaur guy. (runs over to Ross)\nHi, Ross.'
Oh, hi Chloe.'

I want you to met some friends of mine. (Introduces him to Chandler and
Joey) This guy is my hero, he comes in with some stuff he wants it blown up 400%, we said
we don\xc2\x92t do that, and he says you gotta. And y'know what, we did it. And now anytime
anybody wants 400, we just say \xc2\x91let\xc2\x92s Ross it!\xc2\x92"
And that\xc2\x92s the only colour that comes in.'
Yo, Chloe, do you have a quarter for the condom machine?'
Oh! (storms off)'
So, what are you doing here? I thought tonight was your big\nanniversary dinner.'
Yeah, little change in plans. Ahh, we\xc2\x92re gonna break-up instead.'
Oh, and I can also speak a little French. Voulez-vous coucher avec moi\nce soir? (Mischa laughs) Why? What did I say?'
Well, you just asked if I wanted to go to bed with you tonight.'
Oh my God! No wonder I get such great service at Cafe Maurice.'
(laughing and banging her spoon on the table) Knock, knock, knock,\nknock, hi. Um, could you please tell Sergei that um, I was fascinated by what Boutros\nBoutros Gali said in the New York Times.'
You didn\xc2\x92t say Boutros Boutros Gali.'
(to Sergei) Boutros Boutros Gali.'
He says he was too.'
Interesting.'
(to Monica) So I was wondering....'
Okay, ah, before you get all talky again, umm, could you also please\ntell Sergei that I really like his suit.'
(to Phoebe, very quickly) Eh, he said, thank you very much, he thinks\nyou look very pretty tonight, your hair, golden like the sun. (to Monica) So you're a\nchef?"
I\xc2\x92m also thinking about opening up my own restaurant.'
Oh, really.'
Monica, can I talk to you behind my menu, please. (Behind the menu) What\nare you doing?'
Well, I was having a conversation.'
Yeah but, Mischa is so interested in you, that Sergei and I haven\xc2\x92t\nbeen able to say two words to each other.'
What do you want me to do? Just sit here silently while you three have a\nconversation?'
That would be great. Thank you.'
(jumping up to answer the phone) Hello!'
Oh, hi. It\xc2\x92s Mark.'
(disappointed) Oh.'
What? Is it my breath?'
No! Sorry, I just thought you were somebody else. Hi!'
Hi. Well, look, I was just gonna leave a message, isn\xc2\x92t tonight your,\nyour big anniversary dinner?'
Yeah. Well, umm.....'
Rach, are you okay?'
(on the verge of tears) Yeah, I\xc2\x92m fine.'
You wanna talk, I mean I can come over?'
No! Really, no, please, please, that\xc2\x92s, that\xc2\x92s okay.'
All right, all right, I\xc2\x92m coming over, and I\xc2\x92m bringing Chinese\nfood.'
Oh, yeah, I\xc2\x92m not, I\xc2\x92m not hungry.'
It\xc2\x92s for me.'
Oh. Okay, bye.'
So what are you gonna do?'
What can I do? One person wants to break-up, you break-up.'
Hey, no way! Come on, this is you guys, call her and work it out.'
Oh come on, we just had this huge fight, all right, don\xc2\x92t I have to\nwait a while?'
Hey, this isn\xc2\x92t like swimming after you eat, pick up the phone!!'
Y'know that whole swimming thing is a myth."
Yeah, tell that to my Uncle Lenny.'
Why? What happened to him?'
Nothing, he\xc2\x92s just really believes in that.'

Oh, and then, we got into this big, stupid fight. I just, it was awful.\nI told him he treats me like a park ranger, or something, oh and then I told him I wanted\nto take a break, I don\xc2\x92t want to take a break.'
Wow. I\xc2\x92m sorry. Eggroll?'
No. (grabs an eggroll) And then I called him, and he wasn\xc2\x92t there.'
Well, then he\xc2\x92s, he\xc2\x92s probably just, out.'
Oh, thank you that\xc2\x92s very helpful, I\xc2\x92m glad you came over.'
Hello.'
Hi! It\xc2\x92s me.'
Hi! Oh, I\xc2\x92m so glad you called.'
Really? I\xc2\x92ve been thinking, this is crazy, I mean don\xc2\x92t,\ndon\xc2\x92t you think we can work on this? '
Hey, what do you want to drink?'
Who\xc2\x92s that?'
Nobody.'
Is it okay if I finish the apple juice?'
Is that Mark?'
Umm, honey, look he just came over to....'
Yeah! Got it! (slams the phone down, and walks back to the bar.)'
Hey, dinosaur guy, look at you, so sad. Come dance.'
Ah, that\xc2\x92s okay, thanks.'
Hey, you don\xc2\x92t have to smile. You just have to dance.'
Look, I don\xc2\x92t feel like dancing, I feel like having a drink. Okay?'
Oh, okay. (to the bartender) Hey, two beers. (sits down next to him) '
(to Monica) And the vet said it was time. And so from half a world away,\nwhile my Mother held the phone to his ear, I said good bye to my dog,. In seven languages.'
Oh. (to Phoebe) Can I have a tissue?'
Oh, yeah, sure. I just hope you, hope you don\xc2\x92t accidentally suck\nit up through your nose and choke on it.'
(to Phoebe) Sergei, would like to apologise for my behaviour tonight.'
Well, tell him, apology accepted.'

(to Monica) Oh, he\xc2\x92s unbelievable. I mean for the first time in
three years somebody wants to actually want to talk to me, but do you think he would let
me enjoy that, no!! (to Sergei) You silly diplomat, why don\xc2\x92t you learn some English,
Sergei?'
Excuse me, but umm, isn\xc2\x92t he paying for your dinner?'
Hey, the man\xc2\x92s dog just died.'
(to Monica) I have just resigned my post. Would you care to accompany me\nto the Rainbow Room? I have diplomatic coupons.'
It will be my pleasure. (to Phoebe) My guy has diplomatic coupons. Your\nguy can\xc2\x92t even say coupons. (they leave)'
Uh, (picks up a plate) plate?'
Plate! Yes, plate.'
Plate. Plate. Plate.'
See, we don\xc2\x92t need them.'
(picking up a cup) Plate?'
Yeah.'
(to Chloe) I like this song.'
Well, you\xc2\x92re practically dancing already. Why don\xc2\x92t you just do\nit over here?'
Oh, no, no.'
What? Are you married? \xc2\x91Cause that\xc2\x92s okay.'
(picks up the phone and calls Ross) Oh, be home, be home, be home, be\nhome, be home, be home. Be home. Be home, be home, be home. Oh, you\xc2\x92re not home.'
Still no smile?'
(singing) Touchet, touchet, Miss Americccan pie. (stops to correct\nPhoebe) Ameri-ccan.'
Ameri-can.'
Ameri-ccan.'
Ameri-can. Y'know it\xc2\x92s a very hard language. Let\xc2\x92s do\nit again."
(to the rest of Central Perk) Everybody!! (In his language, and\ncontinues.)'
